vehicles.description: A white sedan equipped with emergency warning lights on its roof is directly ahead of the subject vehicle, either stationary or moving slowly, occupying the same lane as the subject vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: The presence on site indicates the possibility of an emergency or law enforcement activity, which may cause vehicles to stop suddenly or deviate from their route. This vehicle should maintain a safe following distance and be prepared to respond to sudden stops or deviations in the traffic flow at any time.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A pedestrian pushing a stroller and leading a dog is crossing the street from right to left in front of a parked sedan.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrian behavior can impact driving actions, as the vehicle needs to slow down and yield to ensure pedestrian safety. Pedestrians near the roadside may suddenly walk onto the road, requiring the vehicle to remain vigilant and be ready to stop at any time.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A person riding a bicycle is traveling in the same direction as the car, on the left side of the lane.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The position of a bicycle rider requires the vehicle to maintain a safe distance and to be prepared for a safe overtaking maneuver when necessary. Cyclists may move unpredictably and change their route at any time, which requires heightened vigilance and readiness to brake at all times.

barriers.description: On the right side, there is a metal railing separating the sidewalk from the road.
barriers.explanation: These obstacles indicate that pedestrians should use the sidewalk, while vehicles should travel on the road, defining the exclusive space for each type of road user. They restrict lateral movement and mark the boundaries of the driving lanes, indicating that a vehicle should maintain a safe distance from the right edge of the road.

other objects.description: Several overhead cables span the road, but they are fixed infrastructure and will not affect driving behavior.
other objects.explanation: Commonly seen in road environments, usually, there is no need for immediate action unless they unexpectedly fall or suddenly pose a danger.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic scene, there is a white sedan with emergency warning lights on its roof directly ahead of the subject vehicle, either stationary or moving slowly in the same lane. This situation suggests the possibility of an emergency or law enforcement activity, requiring vehicles to maintain a safe following distance and be prepared for sudden stops or deviations in traffic flow.

Additionally, a pedestrian is crossing the street from right to left in front of a parked sedan while pushing a stroller and leading a dog. This requires the vehicle to slow down and yield to ensure the pedestrian's safety, as pedestrians may suddenly enter the road, necessitating vigilance and readiness to stop.

Furthermore, a cyclist is traveling in the same direction as the car, positioned on the left side of the lane. The vehicle must keep a safe distance and be ready for a safe overtaking maneuver, as cyclists can move unpredictably and may change their route without warning.

On the right side of the road, there is a metal railing separating the sidewalk from the road, which serves to delineate the space for pedestrians and vehicles, restricting lateral movement and marking the boundaries of the driving lanes. Vehicles should keep a safe distance from the right edge of the road.

Lastly, overhead cables are present, spanning the road. These are fixed infrastructure and typically do not affect driving behavior unless they fall or pose an unexpected danger.

driving_suggestion: Vehicles should reduce speed and prepare to stop, yielding to pedestrians and ensuring a safe passing distance from cyclists. Maintain a safe following distance from the white sedan ahead, especially considering its emergency lights, and be ready to respond to sudden stops or changes in traffic flow. Pay attention to the status of traffic lights and comply with their signals, preparing for possible phase changes. Stay within lane markings and keep a safe distance from obstacles on the right side of the road. Overall, drive cautiously and at a reduced speed to adapt to potential risks presented by road users and the environment.

1.description and explanation: A stroller typically indicates the presence of a young child or baby, requiring the driver to exercise extra caution. Anticipating unpredictable movements and maintaining a safe speed and distance is essential.

2.description and explanation: A dog beside the road may move unpredictably and presents a potential hazard. The driver should reduce speed and be prepared to stop if the dog enters the roadway to ensure safety.
